intro: Dicella macroptera, commonly known as the large-winged dicella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, broad, wing-like leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or white. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Dicella macroptera is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
